sentences.sContent: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.sCn: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.sContent: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.sCn: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.sContent: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.sCn: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.sContent: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.sCn: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

sentences.sContent: ...we think there are lessons from her experience that apply...
...almost all of us will experience a period of radical professional change...
...Some people regard professional change as an unpleasant experience that disturbs their stable careers...
...That people often experience trouble sleeping in a different bed in unfamiliar surroundings is a phenomenon known as the ―first-night‖ effect...
...The experience on Main Street stimulated self-improvement...
...Real-life experience is often more important than formal education for career success...
...Can you tell me something about your experience in this kind of work...
...but real- life experience is often even more valuable...
...They tend to have a lot of experience themselves in the technology business...

phrases.pCn: 实务经验，实践经验，实际经验
工作经验；工作经历；职业经验

words.tran: 老练的，熟练的；富有经验的
经验的；经验上的；根据经验的

trans.tranOther: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this
